Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition: melt down v : reduce or cause to be reduced from a solid to a liquid state, usually by heating; "melt butter"; "melt down gold"; "The wax melted in the sun" [syn: {melt}, {run}]

meltdown n 1: severe overheating of the core of a nuclear reactor resulting in the core melting and radiation escaping [syn: {nuclear meltdown}] 2: a disaster comparable to a nuclear meltdown; "there is little likelihood of a meltdown comparable to the American banking collapse in March 1933"
